perturbation.original_text: The rights and obligations of the parties set forth in Exhibit A shall survive the termination or expiration of this endorsement agreement, regardless of cause or circumstances of the termination or expiration.
perturbation.changed_text: The rights and obligations of the parties set forth in Exhibit A shall survive the termination or expiration of this endorsement agreement only in cases of a breach of contract by the Professional. Otherwise, all obligations expire upon termination of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original statement that the rights and obligations survive termination regardless of the cause. Now, the survival is contingent on a specific cause (breach by the Professional), creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: Recipient hereby assigns and agrees to assign all Recipient's rights in any Intellectual Property to the Company. Recipient hereby grants to the Company power of attorney for the purpose of assigning all Recipient's rights in Intellectual Property to the Company for the purposes of filings, registrations and other formalities deemed necessary by the Company to prosecute, protect, perfect or exploit its ownership and interests in Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: Recipient retains ownership of any Intellectual Property developed before this agreement. Recipient hereby grants to the Company power of attorney for the purpose of assigning all Recipient's rights in Intellectual Property to the Company for the purposes of filings, registrations and other formalities deemed necessary by the Company to prosecute, protect, perfect or exploit its ownership and interests in Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'Recipient retains ownership of any Intellectual Property developed before this agreement' contradicts the original clause that Recipient assigns all rights in Intellectual Property to the Company, creating uncertainty about ownership.

perturbation.original_text: The confidentiality and non-use obligations of Recipient will remain in effect after all work for the Company has been completed.
perturbation.changed_text: The confidentiality and non-use obligations of Recipient will remain in effect for a period of one year after all work for the Company has been completed. However, the Company reserves the right to terminate these obligations at any time with written notice to the Recipient.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the confidentiality obligations were indefinite. Now, it's limited to one year, BUT the Company can terminate it at any time. This introduces uncertainty because the actual duration of confidentiality is not fixed and depends on the Company's decision, contradicting the initial one-year limit.
